Operation 'getCheckinURLs' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too generic and doesn't indicate the filtering capability by airline. Description is completely empty, providing no context about inputs, outputs, or use case. Enhanced version specifies that the operation filters by airline code, explains the business purpose (accessing check-in services), clarifies input parameters (IATA codes), describes the response structure (CheckinLink collection), and provides context for AI agents to understand when to use this operation. Terminology aligns with aviation domain conventions.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve airline check-in links by airline code
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves check-in URLs for specified airlines. This operation returns direct links to airline check-in pages, enabling users to access online check-in services. Accepts airline IATA codes as input parameters and returns a collection of CheckinLink objects containing URLs and metadata for each requested airline. Useful for integrating airline check-in functionality into travel applications.
